title: What is the role of symbols in esoteric knowledge and why is hermetic-alchemical form important in the Western tradition?
first_phrase: In the preceding text, the author discussed the use of symbols in esoteric knowledge and the limitation of a rational understanding of them. In this last part, the author will further delve into the technical value of symbols and the sense behind the hermetic-alchemical form adopted by Western esoteric tradition. The author argues that symbols play a crucial role in esoteric knowledge, just as concepts do in rational and logical knowledge. The technical justification for using symbols is to train the mind to understand through seeing, rather than thinking, which is how contemporary society is accustomed to. The hermetic philosophy is thus a philosophy of silence, seeking to connect readers more to mute figures and graphical emblems, rather than words.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the fundamental technical justification for the use of symbols, especially graphic symbols, is to train the mind to understand by seeing rather than just thinking. Therefore, the hermetic philosophy of silence is cultivated by all initiation schools as a way of escaping from the tyranny of words. Symbols do not offer a grip to reason; they require the use of other faculties for proper comprehension. Inhibiting the pathway through which knowledge flows into a series of formulated thoughts in words is the key to unlocking the treasures of esoteric wisdom.
